content:
Tole sem zasledil.Bomo videli kaj jim bo odpisal nazaj.

In light of the current Eurozone Crisis, I wish to bring to your attention EVIDENCE that the Slovenian government, led by Ms Alenka Bratusek, is continuing to block crucial Eurozone reforms in the Central European country of Slovenia despite your warnings to act immediately.

The fact is Ms Bratusek refuses to pass an important reform that was introduced into the Slovenian Parliament to REMOVE all corrupt former communist party officials who still control and effectively run Slovenian banks, state owned companies, the media, education and other institutions in Slovenia. This law would also remove all former communist agents, collaborators, spies and human rights abusers from key positions in Slovenia and the EU and is in line with the Council of Europe Resolution 1096 of which Slovenia is a signatory.

See here: http://www.gibanje-ops.com/pri...s-in-na-odgovor

Had this law been passed, corrupt, incompetent officials who are responsible for the current crisis in Slovenia would have been removed from their positions. Instead Ms Bratusek continues to do nothing.

The questions that need to be answered here are;

1. Why is the current Slovenian Prime Minister Ms Alenka Bratusek refusing to enact this crucial reform? What is she scared of?

2. Why did the Slovenian media video tape the introduction of the law into the Slovenian Parliament but then censored it from their major news bulletins? Who made the decision to remove this story from the new bulletin and why? Was there political pressure placed on the media to censure the story?

See the official media version that never went to air and the version recorded by a civic organisation called OPS here: http://www.gibanje-ops.com/pri...do-po-slovensko

3. Why is Ms Bratusek a member of a controversial Slovenian political party known as "Positive Slovenia" which is led by a Serb born communist called Mr Jankovic, an individual who has close links to the former communist dictatorship and who was condemned in a Resolution on Totalitarianism after naming a street in the Slovenian capital in honour of a murderous Pedophile Totalitarian communist Dictator despite protests from victims and their families whilst he was Mayor?

Read the Resolution here:

http://www.32462857769.net/EPP...INAL_copy_1.pdf

4. Does Ms Bratusek agree with her leader Mr Jankovic that murderous totalitarian Dictators must be promoted and glorified in violation of EU and International Resolutions?

5. Why doesn't Ms Bratusek honour and respect the 20,000 or more Slovenian men, women and children who were murdered by the former communist totalitarian dictatorship and respect Resolutions on Totalitarianism by demolishing all symbols of the former communist totalitarian dictatorship such as memorials and statues that glorify dictators, mass murderers and human rights abusers and by removing the names of murderous communist despots and pedophiles such as Dictator Tito and other members of the former totalitarian regime from all streets, squares and public places throughout Slovenia?

These are serious questions that need to be answered by the Slovenian Prime Minister Ms Bratusek.

Any EU bailout money to Slovenia must be conditional on the Slovenian government completing ALL the above.

If Ms Bratusek is not prepared to respect Eurozone rules and victims of totalitarianism, then the EU should not respect her or her government.

Looking forward to your response.

http://www.gibanje-ops.com/pri...affairs-mr-rehn

ti maš še vedno vizijo da se lahko mi sami rešimo ? 
 
	

	
	
		
		

		
		
	


	
		
	



		
		Klikni za razširitev
	
Ti imaš še vedno naivno upanje, da bodo drugi skrbeli za našo dobrobit, namesto za lastne koristi?

Avstroogrska in zatiranje slovenstva, kravje kupčije angležev in ostalih "velikih sil" po svetovnih vojnah (meje, ujetniki...) so že globoko v pozabi?
author: Tku

content:
Sploh se ne gre za to da skrbijo za našo dobrobit, pri nas je rešitev dokaj enostavno, spucat javni sektor, ker je predrag.

Ampak lastna politika tega ne more narediti, ker so sindikati preveč močni. Če pa pride kakšna druga vlada, pa jih boli [cenzura] za politične točke in bodo naredili reze tam, kjer se more, potem pa odšli.
